question: __________ is the process of extending a pattern by placing it inside itself
An experiment design that assigns each participant to multiple condition is called a __________ subjects design
An iconic symbol bears a __________ resemblance to what it refers to
The basic units of meaning in a language are __________
__________ are meaningless speech sounds that serve as the fundamental building blocks of language
The set of rules for ordering words and phrases into sentences is known as __________
The ability to refer to things and events beyond the here and now is called __________
The question of whether human language evolved gradually or rapidly is known as the __________ debate
Two members of the same species are known as __________
__________ holds whatever we are currently thinking about
When a test produces the similar results over repeated manipulations it is said to possess _________
A quick movement of the eyes while reading is known as a __________, and a momentary gaze of the eyes on a single location while reading is known as a __________
A memory task in which participants are allowed to repeat the items in fixed order is called a __________ recall task
The __________ lobe at that side of the head processes auditory input from the ears and is also responsible for object recognition
__________ is an implicit memory process which enhances retrieval of an item due to previous exposure of similar items
__________ learning is a form of learning that takes place outside of conscious awareness
The __________ is an ERP component that has been linked to the processing of semantic anomaly
Time difference between stimulus presentation and response initiation is called __________
The percentage of correct responses over a set of trials is known as __________
__________ is a condition due to brain damage and characterized by fluent speech that is filled with vocabulary errors accompanied by difficulty in comprehending speech
The number of wavelengths of sound that pass a given point in a given amount of time is called ___
A structure extending inside the length of the cochlea which also divides it into two is called the____________ membrane
The observation that there is no reliable relationship between a phoneme and the acoustic signal is known as __________
The process of filling in missing segments of the speech stream with contextually appropriate material is known as __________
During one cycle the amount of change a wave goes though is called __________
Pattern of frequencies in the speech stream along with their temporal change can be displayed through_________________
The process of experiencing continuously changing stimuli as belonging to two or more discrete sets is called __________ perception

The __________ effect is an artificially induced illusion in which the auditory information for one speech sound, such as b, is combining with the visual information for another speech sound, such as g, to produce the perception of a third speech sound, such as d
Frequencies higher than the fundamental frequency that are also produced by a vibrating object are called __________
The psychological perception of sound wave complexity is known as __________
Restricting airflow at _________________ locations within the oral cavity produces a consonant sound
A(n) __________ is a vowel combination that is perceived as a single phoneme
The frames-then-content model explains babbling in terms of repeated __________ movements
As per the dual stream model the ventral stream is also known as the “__________” stream, and the dorsal stream is also known as the “__________” stream
According to the Wernicke-Geschwind model __________ is a band of neural fibers extending from the temporal lobe to the frontal lobe
Damage to the cerebellum can lead to a condition known as __________, which is a motor speech disorder characterized by poor articulation of phonemes and prosody
A __________ model is a computer program that simulates a cognitive process in a manner that is consistent with what is currently known about human cognition
Babbling uttered as the infant approaches and manipulates a novel object is called __________-directed vocalization
A consonant sound like b or p that is produced by bringing the upper and lower lips together is called a(n) __________ consonant
__________ aphasia is a condition in which brain damage leads to a loss of speech production without a loss of speech comprehension
__________ vocabulary is the set of words a person can recognize and understand the meaning
Daddy and Baby are playing. Daddy picks up the toy horse and says “Look at the horsie!” before handing it to Baby. In doing this, Daddy has created __________
The concept of __________ refers to the storage of information about words in long-term memory
A relationship between two words that frequently co-occur, such as dog and bone, is called __________
__________ vocabulary is the set of words a person can use in appropriate contexts
The assumption that a new word refers to the entire object and not just a part of it is called the __________ assumption
__________ is a measure of how often a particular word in all its forms occurs in a language
A relationship between to words that belong to the same category, such as dog and cat, is called __________
The most basic form of a word is called its __________
Generally speaking, we can define a __________ as a minimal unit of meaningful speech that can stand alone
____________ are set of rules for ordering words in a sentence
A sentence structure in which the patient is mapped onto the subject position is said to be in __________
A sentence that is placed inside of another sentence for the purpose of describing a noun is called a __________
__________ word order defines sequence of sentence elements in a language
A sentence structure in which the agent is mapped onto the subject position is said to be in __________
A two-staged model of sentence processing in which syntactic analysis precedes semantic interpretation is known as the __________ model
Mean length of utterance, or MLU, is the standard measure of a child’s __________
A __________ is a simple sentence that is part of a larger complex sentence
A syntactic parsing strategy that assumes the simplest possible sentence structure is known as __________
A syntactic structure that attaches an introductory clause to the beginning of a sentence for the purpose of highlighting one of the participants in the event is known as a __________ sentence
Information that all participants of a conversation share are called __________
The framework guiding the presentation of events and characters in a narrative is known as __________
The __________ ground is the information that one interlocutor knows but the other one doesn’t

A __________ is a mental framework for organizing our understanding of how some aspect of the world works. We have these for all sorts of social behaviors that we engage in, such as eating in a restaurant or going out on a date
The __________ is the entity in the discourse that an anaphor refers back to
Semantically empty words like uh and um that signal planning difficulties are known as __________
The __________ is the speaker’s intended meaning behind an utterance
__________ is the spontaneous speech people use as they engage in joint activities
The term __________ refers to the various ways that context contributes to the meaning of a discourse
__________ gestures, which are hand movements that speakers make while they talk, tend to be lined up at the clause level
People who can speak two or languages fluently are called _________
__________ is a change from one language to another within a single interaction
An experimental procedure that asks participants to name as many members of a given category as possible is known as a __________ task
The __________ hypothesis suggests that bilinguals’ constant need to monitor and control their languages leads to benefits in nonverbal cognition
The language spoken in an immigrant’s country of origin is called his or her __________ language
Words in two different languages that refer to the same concept are called __________
The __________ model is a theory of language processing that assumes separate lexicons for each language connected by a common underlying conceptual level
The number of years spent in the country where the second language is spoken is called the learner’s __________
The ability to ignore distracting or misleading information is known as __________
The __________ hypothesis proposes that children have a biological predisposition to learn languages but lose this ability around puberty
